scenario_text.value:
Phew... I’m glad it wasn’t anything too
tough.
Miu, are you okay? You’re not hurt, are you?
No, I’m not hurt, but...

(Miu’s actually shaking. Getting ambushed
like that must’ve really scared her.)

(All this fog ahead means there’s no looking
for Aoi, and enemies could be anywhere.)

(It might be best for Miu to head back to the
school for now.)

(But if I say that, she might not listen, and
dig in her heels if I say it’s dangerous.)

(Maybe if I suggest that we might’ve missed
Aoi, I can ask her to search the way back.)
(How can I convince Miu?)
Say it’s dangerous.
Suggest we missed Aoi.
Say it’s dangerous.

Well, I don’t see how we can go any farther
than this, and enemies could be anywhere.

Considering the danger, I think you and
Shakomon should head back to the school, Miu.
Are...are you saying we’d only slow you down?

No, no, nothing like that. Besides, look at
you. You’re still shaking.
Th-that’s just because I got startled!

Miu, I think we should listen to Takuma right
now.

Things worked out because that enemy was
weak, but what if the next one’s stronger?

Oh, all right. I’ll go back to the school
with Shakomon.
Suggest we missed Aoi.

Looks like we can’t go any farther, and I’d
hate to think we missed Aoi on the way here.

Miu, do you think you could retrace your
steps and see if you find any sign of her?
You...you want my help?

Right. Do you think you and Shakomon can do
that for me?

Sure thing! Leave it to me, it’ll be a piece
of cake!

That’d be a big help. I’m counting on you,
okay?
No problem! I’ll get started right away!
Heheh... Nicely done, Takuma. I’m impressed.

Miu will be much happier this way than if you
told her to go back because of the danger.
Haha, you’re on to me, huh, Shakomon?

Shakomon! What’s taking you so long? If you
don’t hurry, I’ll leave without you!
All right Miu, I’ll be right there!

Okay, good. Now at least I won’t have to
worry about Miu.
Let’s keep looking around.
Yeah!
